method.name: can_create_more_anchors
method.description: Check if any more anchor trackers can be created. Always returns [code]false[/code] if anchors are not supported.

method.name: create_anchor_tracker
method.description: Create a new [OpenXRAndroidAnchorTracker], positioned at [param pose]. Unlike trackables, anchor trackers are not "discovered", as in, they must always be explicitly created. Note that the [OpenXRAndroidAnchorTracker]'s location may not be ready. See also [method OpenXRAndroidAnchorTracker.get_location_pose]. If [param trackable] is not [code]null[/code], then the [OpenXRAndroidAnchorTracker] will only be available when the trackable is found.

method.name: destroy_anchor_tracker
method.description: Destroys the underlying tracker. [param anchor_tracker] can be discarded after calling this function.

method.name: discover_trackables
method.description: Query all available trackables detected by the OpenXR runtime. This API is called automatically by default (see [method set_trackable_discovery_cooldown]). If [param update_trackers] is [code]true[/code], all found trackers are updated. If [param update_trackers] is [code]false[/code], all found trackers are not updated. This is useful if you need to find new trackers/discard old trackers without updating all of them too. Each new tracker is added to [XRServer]. Each absent tracker is removed from [XRServer].

method.name: get_anchor_trackers
method.description: Retrieve an [Array] of all [OpenXRAndroidAnchorTracker]s that have been created, and not yet destroyed, this session.

method.name: get_location_flags
method.description: Convenience function to turn this: [codeblock] var anchor_flags: OpenXRAndroidAnchorTracker.LocationFlags if anchor_tracker: anchor_flags = anchor_tracker.get_location_flags(update) [/codeblock] Into: [codeblock] var anchor_flags: OpenXRAndroidAnchorTracker.LocationFlags = OpenXRAndroidTrackablesExtension.get_location_flags(anchor_tracker, update) [/codeblock] See also [method OpenXRAndroidAnchorTracker.get_location_flags].

method.name: get_location_pose
method.description: Convenience function to turn this: [codeblock] var anchor_pose: Transform3D if anchor_tracker: anchor_pose = anchor_tracker.get_location_pose(update) [/codeblock] Into: [codeblock] var anchor_pose: Transform3D = OpenXRAndroidTrackablesExtension.get_location_pose(anchor_tracker, update) [/codeblock] See also [method OpenXRAndroidAnchorTracker.get_location_pose].

method.name: is_trackables_supported
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if trackables is supported; otherwise [code]false[/code].

method.name: set_anchor_tracker_update_cooldown
method.description: Set how many frames to wait before automatically calling [method update_anchor_trackers]. When [param cooldown] is [code]0[/code], [method update_anchor_trackers] is called every frame. Note that the XR runtime may not always have new data to retrieve. When [param cooldown] is less than zero, [method update_anchor_trackers] is no longer called automatically. Your app can explicitly update anchors by calling [method update_anchor_trackers]. Default is [code]60[/code].

method.name: set_trackable_discovery_cooldown
method.description: Set how many frames to wait before automatically calling [method discover_trackables]. When [param cooldown] is [code]0[/code], [method discover_trackables] is called every frame. Note that the XR runtime may not always have new data to retrieve. When [param cooldown] is less than zero, [method discover_trackables] is no longer called automatically. Your app can explicitly add/remove/update all trackables by calling [method discover_trackables], or update individual trackers by calling any getter function in [OpenXRAndroidTrackableTracker] or deriving classes. Default is [code]60[/code].

method.name: update_anchor_trackers
method.description: Update all anchor trackers; updating their pose and persist state (see [method OpenXRAndroidAnchorTracker.get_persist_state] and [method OpenXRAndroidAnchorTracker.get_location_pose]). This API is called automatically by default (see [method set_anchor_tracker_update_cooldown]).
